p: Luteolin, 3′,4′,5,7-tetrahydroxyflavone (Fig. 7) which belongs to the flavone group of flavonoids, is a natural yellow dye found widely in the plant kingdom including fruits, vegetables, and medicinal herbs such as broccoli, pepper, thyme, and celery, carrots, olive oil, peppermint, thyme, rosemary, oregano, rosemary, navel oranges, dandelion, perilla leaf, chamomile tea [ 86].
